Name: Le Sommeil d'Ulisse
Source/Collection: Cantates Françoises à Une, et à Trois Voix avec Simphonie
Notes: The third book, the last volume of La Guerres Cantates francoises, is based on secular themes of the ancient world. It contains three works: Sémélé, L'île de Délos and Le Sommeil d'Ulisse. The form and the good use of the obbligato instruments make the cantata varied and interesting. Particularly noteworthy is the programmatic design of sleep and the storm. Practical playing edition with B.c. realization.
Long Description: Le Sommeil d'Ulisse is from the third cantata book by de la Guerre, which is based on secular themes of antiquity. The form and the good use of the obbligato instruments make the cantata varied and interesting. Particularly noteworthy is the programmatic design of sleep and the storm. Practical playing edition with B.c. realization.
Short Description: A cantata by E.-C. Jacquet de La Guerre, part of the third book of Cantates Françoises, featuring mezzo soprano, tenor, violin, flute, and basso continuo.
